name: shaded
content:
shaded adjective
(DARK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
slightly dark because something blocks direct light from the sun: Nothing will grow in the shaded part of the garden.
coloured slightly darker than other parts of a diagram, picture or painting: The shaded areas of the plans show where the houses will be built. Related word
shade
More examplesFewer examplesThey ate lunch in the shaded front yard.We have shaded outdoor seating.The woodland paths are scenic and shaded.1.3 percentage points is accounted for by changes in GDP growth (the dark blue shaded area).Lightly shaded parts represent clay soils.

Pictures
shaded adjective
(SKILFUL)
approving including many subtle (= not obvious) and slight differences, in a way that is skilful: Her playing is subtle and beautifully shaded.
More examplesFewer examplesDelicately shaded performances complement the thrilling, suspenseful narrative.The composer drew beautifully shaded playing from the ensemble.It's hard to be negative about a movie so subtly shaded and well-acted.
